content.question: A second experiment is done under identical conditions using a higher concentration of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> in the presence of the same mass of <math alttext="M n O 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MnO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>. The volume of gas collected during the first 60 seconds will most likely be

choices.label: less than <math alttext="42 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>42</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math>
equal to <math alttext="42 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>42</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math>
greater than <math alttext="42 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>42</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math>

impossible to predict without knowing the actual concentration of <math alttext="H 2 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> used in the two experiments

content.answer: greater than <math alttext="42 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>42</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Formulate a hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
